iebaker.neon.world

Class CellWorld

  • java.lang.Object
    • iebaker.neon.world.CellWorld
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TacWorld

    public class CellWorld
extends java.lang.Object
    CellWorld is a basic class representing a 2D world made up of single Cells.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Cell[][] grid
      The actual grid of cells which makes up this world
      protected Graph grid_graph
      A graph representation of this world, for use by autonomous entities
      protected float gridwidth
      The floating point width of a single grid square.
      protected int my_height
      The height of the world, in number of cells tall
      protected int my_width
      The width of the world, in number of cells across

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CellWorld(float gw, int width, int height)
      Constructs a new CellWorld with a specified Cell sidelength, a specified number of cells in the y direction, and a specified number of cells in the x direction.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cell cellAt(int x, int y)
      Returns the cell at index [x][y]
      Graph getGraph()
      Returns a reference to the graph object behind the cellworld, for use in Pathfinding
      float getGridwidth()
      Accessor for the width of a single grid square
      Vec2f getStartingCenter()
      Returns the centerpoint at which to start the focus of the Viewport.
      float getStartingScale()
      Returns the scale at which to begin the viewport.
      float getTotalHeight()
      Accessor for the total height of the world
      float getTotalWidth()
      Accessor for the total width of the world
      int getXLength()
      Accessor for the number of grid cells along the x dimension
      int getYLength()
      Accessor for the number of grid cells along the y dimension
      void onDraw(Artist a, java.awt.Graphics2D g)
      Should draw a picture of the world in its own coordinates
      void onTick(long nanos)
      Propagates ticking to all Cells

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • grid

        protected Cell[][] grid
        The actual grid of cells which makes up this world

      • grid_graph

        protected Graph grid_graph
        A graph representation of this world, for use by autonomous entities

      • gridwidth

        protected float gridwidth
        The floating point width of a single grid square. Should be large enough to permit sprite rendering

      • my_width

        protected int my_width
        The width of the world, in number of cells across

      • my_height

        protected int my_height
        The height of the world, in number of cells tall

        Accessor for the total width of the world
        Returns:

        Accessor for the total height of the world

        public void onTick(long nanos)
        Propagates ticking to all Cells

      • onDraw

        public void onDraw(Artist a,
          java.awt.Graphics2D g)
        Should draw a picture of the world in its own coordinates

      • getStartingCenter

        public Vec2f getStartingCenter()
        Returns the centerpoint at which to start the focus of the Viewport. By default, returns the center of the world, but implementations should perhaps focus on the player's starting position.
        Returns:
        a Vec2f representing the starting centerpoint of the world

      • getStartingScale

        public float getStartingScale()
        Returns the scale at which to begin the viewport. By default, returns a 1:10 scale
        Returns:
        A float representing the starting scale of the world's viewport

      • cellAt

        public Cell cellAt(int x,
          int y)
        Returns the cell at index [x][y]
        Returns:
        a Cell which is located at [x][y], or null if the cell is not located in the world

      • getGraph

        public Graph getGraph()
        Returns a reference to the graph object behind the cellworld, for use in Pathfinding
        Returns:
        A Graph object whose vertices and edges represent passable areas in the CellWorld
